message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.RO, cs.NI 

This paper focuses on the design and development of a wearable device that measures breathing and sends biofeedback in real-time. The evaluation of the device includes gathering qualitative data on the wearable device's design and how the breathing patterns were interpreted in a fixed environment. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of conveying physiological signals as biofeedback to users, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of wearable technologies and their impact on communication and empathy, which could fall under the categories of cybernetics (cs.CY), social and information networks (cs.SI), robotics (cs.RO), and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
